alert.note: Alert for Caddo; Canadian; Comanche; Grady; Jackson; Kiowa; McClain; Stephens; Tillman (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 09 at 3:16AM CDT until July 09 at 4:00AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: The National Weather Service in Norman has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Comanche County in southwestern Oklahoma... Grady County in central Oklahoma... Caddo County in southwestern Oklahoma... Northwestern Stephens County in southern Oklahoma... Northeastern Jackson County in southwestern Oklahoma... Eastern Kiowa County in southwestern Oklahoma... Northern Tillman County in southwestern Oklahoma... South central Canadian County in central Oklahoma... West central McClain County in central Oklahoma... * Until 400 AM CDT. * At 315 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 6 miles northeast of Cogar to near Friendship, moving southeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Hinton Mesonet site reported 70 mph wind gust. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... Southwestern Oklahoma City, Lawton, Altus, Chickasha, Newcastle, Blanchard, Anadarko, Tuttle, Cache, Elgin, Goldsby, Carnegie, Union City, Minco, Apache, Snyder, Rush Springs, Fletcher, Cyril, and Dibble. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.

area.areaDesc: Caddo; Canadian; Comanche; Grady; Jackson; Kiowa; McClain; Stephens; Tillman
